column1: ,TRUE,5,5,2,4,5 koen_theys","2018-01-17T13:55:52.283Z","A hidden gem: Pirate Treasure Hunt","
column6: >At 33 of age, Lego Junior seemed like something for oversized toddlers for whom Duplo is getting to small. Oo boy was I wrong. Just look at this set, you get
>And did I already mentioned the very rare black gold chest? check check check ching ching ching CHINGBOOWHA

column7: s red, it has got to be good. All funny stuff aside, I do like the box, decent display of all minifigs and parts, with a nice colorful surrounding (ocean and island and even a shade of a Lugger in the back)

column6: >It is a small set, but yet it is big in what you get. The parts included, are not your typically parts. Manson brick, huge printed window brick, chain, small rowboat, oars, printed treasure map tile, barrel, pirate flag, guns and swords.
>Skeleton (with extra parts would you lose an arm/leg
>Simple built, that should be obvious as this set is aimed for 4-year olds
>I do love the oars of the rowboat. LEGO added red cones to the oars and that gives the oars and the row boat a premium look. I do not know if it has done before by LEGO but it is a great feature.
>Very lovely set. Feeling a proud owner.

column5: >The value for money is awesome. The playability is also a big plus. I added this to our (me and my 5 year old daughter) LEGO City set. I have built a cave in our water area and putted the skeleton island in it. A place for the crooks to hide all their stolen goods, protected by their skeleton friend.
column6: The pirate captain also rows trough our waters, looking for treasure.

column1: 5 year old daughters rating: big smile, lot'
column2: s of fantasy and already lots of played hours

column1: overall: WINNER ... a hidden gem ... no more for us ... yet just for our City police

column1:
,TRUE,5,5,3,5,5 AranLewis","2015-11-28T19:31:50.273Z","Brucey Bonus","

As the title suggests this set is a nice little bonus to the recent Pirates wave which first pulled me into Lego in the mid 90'
column2: s so maybe nostalgia has played a part in this review.

column1: Standard format for the Juniors line with nice themed box &
column2: instruction art. The instructions are ok and ony necessary due to this being a juniors line, for any other age range the box art would be enough guidance to complete the build.&nbsp

column3: rare pieces, the grey barrel, black treasure chest and brick effect 2x1 spring to mid straight away as well as the large printed wall piece.

column1: Great pirate minifig, probably unique and certainly different to any others available in the current pirate theme. Plenty of accessories as well including flag, sword, gun &
column2: map as well as the skeleton providing an additional bandana piece.

column3: is probably a strong word to use for ths set however it does still do well to set the treasure island scene as intended and also keeping it simple for the target age range.

column1: The completed model is quite pleasing and whilst being light on minifigures and maybe therefore playability
column2: it probably packs more of a punch as a scene than the shipwreck defence set at a similar price does but I would recommend both to fans of the theme.

column1: A definite for any Pirate fans and also a fairly cheap way to pick up a shark and a rowing boat as well as some of the other attractive pieces.
